intro: Anacampseros vespertina, commonly known as the evening star cactus, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its unique adaptations to arid environments. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a short, thick stem with clusters of fleshy, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, appearing in the evening, hence its common name. Anacampseros vespertina is a low-maintenance succulent suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
